resort to something.translation[0].defin: to do something bad, extreme, or difficult because you cannot think of any other way to deal with a problem
Officials fear that extremists may resort to violence.
Vets have had to resort to killing the animals.
resort to something.translation[1].defin: to take a bad or unpleasant course of action because everything else has failed
The company may resort to a temporary closure of its only plant.
We regret we must resort to legal action.
